title: Cyber Spring GM
description: Cyber returns Wednesday Week 1 to kick off the new quarter! Come check out some of the exciting stuff we've planned for this quarter and enjoy a sparkly new set of beginner-friendly CTF + social challenges!

title: B01lers CTF: w/ Minecraft Seedfinding Talk

title: Cyber Academy
description: Cyber Academy general meeting

title: Cyber Lab: Cowrie
description: It's not a sea snail üêå, it's a honeypot üçØ! Join Dylan this Wednesday for a sweet sweet talk on the Cowrie SSH honeypot! üòã

title: CTF IRL
description: ** RSVP and Waiver Form Required: https://l.acmcyber.com/ctfirl **. By popular demand, we‚Äôre back with another one! Come join us on the IM field from 6-8:30PM on Friday, 5/10, where you get to play, yes, ACTUAL Capture the Flag. You heard that right! Run around and touch grass to your heart‚Äôs content as we compete in teams to actually grab flags and see nature as it was intended to be: not on a computer screen as an image.

title: Cyber Academy: The XZ Backdoor
description: How did one mysterious developer nearly take over every server in the world? Join Mark this Monday for an exciting retrospective on the recently thwarted XZ Backdoor!

title: Cyber Lab: AI Privacy
description: Got data? AI would like to know your location... Join Rathul this Wednesday for an amazing talk on AI Privacy techniques!

title: PBR: OAuth & R3CTF/YUANHENGCTF
description: Ooooh, it's Stewart's talk on OAuth! Join PBR (in person) this weekend for R3kapig's first CTF!

title: Cyber x Studio Social: Videogame
description: Grab your controllers üéÆ and ready your blue shells üê¢ - Cyber's teamin' up with ACM Studio ü¶é for a night of videogame and fun ü•≥!

title: Cyber Lab: Career Talk

You'll learn all about cool, different pathways you can take within the cybersecurity field, so make sure to pull up!! üí™ü§ëüíï

title: PBR: Format String Pwn & GPNCTF
description: Come pull up and hear a talk from Alex Zhang on format strings!

title: Cyber Lab: Video Game Anti-Piracy
description: Cyber Lab weekly meeting.

title: ACM Winter GM
description:
Interested in building your own iOS application, developing neural networks, creating your own video game from scratch, or just learning about what technology is? Curious about open-source projects and cloud computing? Then come join ACM for our Winter General Meeting (GM) to learn about how you can get involved in these and more!

RSVP for our Winter GM here: https://forms.gle/f9CEyaSzG1Qs92uF9

title: Cyber Winter GM
description: Cyber is back and better than ever, with even more exciting things for you to hack! Come out to meet our new team members and find out what events and projects we have in store for you this quarter! We'll also be running a mini Capture-the-Flag competition like we did during our Fall GM, so be sure to bring a computer!

title: Cyber Lab: Symmetric Cryptography & AES
description: Have you heard of encryption? Are you curious about the uses of cryptography? Come to Boelter 4760 from 6-8pm to learn about how your web traffic is encrypted and kept secure! We will be covering symmetric cryptography and AES. See you there!

title: PBR: Coppersmith's Attack
description: Do you want to learn more about cryptography and how it can be used to perform cryptographic attacks? Come join PBR for CTF solving and a very interesting talk about Coppersmith's Attack done by Danniell Xu. It'll be from 12-5pm at Boelter 8500. See you there!

title: Cyber Academy: How to Break Into CTFs for Beginners
description: Are you new to cybersecurity? Are you interested in trying security challenges in a CTF? Come to Boelter 5249 from 6-8pm to hear Jason Jiang's talk on How to Break into CTFs for Beginners! Great opportunity for people curious about CTFs, hope to see you there!

title: Cyber Lab: Burpsuite
description: Have you wondered how the security of web applications are tested? Are you interested in pentesting? Have you heard of Burp Suite? Come to Boelter 5249 from 6-8pm to hear Stewart Kwok's talk about Burpsuite!

title: PBR: TetCTF & Heap Binary Exploitation
description: Would you like to get some CTF practice in? Come compete as part of PBR for TetCTF 2024! Alex will be doing a talk on heap binary exploitation. 12-5pm at Boelter 8500, see you there!

title: Cyber Academy: Operation Triangulation
description: Interested in iPhone security? Come listen to Yashica Prasad's presentation on Operation Triangulation, a zero-click iMessage attack design to obtain root privileges and infect a target with malware. See you at Boelter 5249 from 6-8pm!

title: Cyber Lab: CPU Vulnerabilities
description: Are you interested in vulnerabilities in computers? Would you like to learn about CPU Vulnerabilities? (C)ome (P)ull (U)p to Boelter 4760 from 6-8pm for Aditya Pai's talk about CPU Vulnerabilities. See you there!

title: Cyber Academy: Laurie Kirk
description: Come out to Cyber Academy today to hear from our amazing guest speaker, Laurie Kirk! Get ready to learn about her experience as a reverse engineer at Microsoft and prepare to ask her any questions you may have. See you on Zoom from 6-8 pm!

title: Cyber Lab: Strellic
description: Come out to Cyber Lab today to hear from our amazing guest speaker, Strellic! Learn about his experience playing CTFs with DiceGang, studies at UC Berkeley, and security engineering work at Cure53. See you in Boelter 4760 from 6-8 pm!

title: Cyber Academy: SSTI & Pyjails
description: Are you interested in server side attacks? You want to learn how to escape a restricted shell? Come find out how to break out of pyjails and how to perform a server side template injection at Vishal Yathish's talk at Boelter 5249 from 6-8pm. See you there!

title: Cyber Lab: Formal Verification
description: Are you interested in machine learning? Are you curious about how to verify that software will operate correctly? Come join us at Boelter 4760 from 6-8pm to hear from Renuka about Formal Verification of Neural Networks. See you there!

title: LA CTF 2024
description:
Looking for a fun way to spend the weekend?

Then join LA CTF! Our cybersecurity event and capture-the-flag style competition is perfect for everyone, from complete beginners to advanced hackers. From February 16th - 18th, you'll have the chance to solve challenges, develop new skills, make new friends, and have a great time!

In addition to the thrilling competition, LA CTF will also feature speeches from a variety of cybersecurity experts, including UCLA professors and alumni, prizes, and many other events and learning opportunities.

Regardless of your experience level, major, or year, LA CTF has something for you!  Don‚Äôt have a lot of time? Feel free to register and commit as much time as you can!

Check out our website to learn more, and if you have any questions, contact us at lactf+uclacyber@gmail.com or join our Discord for a faster response. We look forward to seeing you there!

meta._comment: ^ the newsletter cannot handle multiple-day events so I'll add 3 events for the three separate days manually lol

title: Cyber Lab: Security Race Conditions
description: What happens when a system tries to perform two conflicting actions at the same time? How can we use this undesirable behavior to exploit systems? Come to Boelter 4760 from 6-8pm to learn more about Security Race Condition from Vera!

title: Cyber Academy: Weijia Yan
description: Come by Boelter 4760 from 6-8pm to hear from our special guest speaker! You can hear about Weijia Yan's work as a Security Engineer and her experience from previously being a PicoCTF organizer! There will be opportunities to ask her questions, so we hope to see you there!

title: Cyber Lab: Firmware Rev
description: Have you heard of firmware? Are you interested in hacking hardware? Come to Boelter 4760 fom 6-8pm to learn about Firmware Reverse Engineering from Rory's talk. See you there!

title: PBR: OSU! Gaming CTF & CSS/Font Injection + XSLeaks
description: JavaScript injection, sql injection, font injection. Come compete at OSU! Gaming CTF and learn about web security through Ronak's talk about CSS/Font Injection and XSLeaks! It'll be from 12-5pm at Boelter 8500. Hope to see you there!

title: Cyber Academy: Economics of Security Vulnerabilities
description: Have you ever thought about the business side of cybersecurity? Do you want a better understanding of the decisions made when it comes to security? Come attend Benson's talk at Boelter 5249 from 6-8pm on the Economics of Security Vulnerabilities. See you there!

title: Cyber Lab: Windows Reverse Engineering
description: Do you like learning how things work? Would you like to know more about Windows software? Come by Boelter 4760 at 6-8pm to hear Salma's Talk on Windows Rev. Come by!

title: PBR: WxMCTF 2024 & Browser Binary Exploitation
description: Are you interested in learning low level hacking? What about web security? Come compete in WxMCTF at Boelter 8500 form 12-5pm and hear Enzo's talk on Browser Binary Exploitation! See you there!

title: AI x Cyber Symposium
description: Come by Kinsey 1240B from 6-8pm to see all the cool projects ACM Cyber and ACM AI have been working on all quarter. You can present and learn about what the coolest clubs have been up to this quarter! See you there for our last event of the quarter!

title: ACM Fall GM

This Fall, we'll be holding a series of workshops üõ† to launch your journey üöÄ to secure a satellite system üõ∞Ô∏è in Winter! description: ‚ùÑÔ∏è It's been freezing out there in the cold LA fall üçÅ... so join us this üåÉ **FRIDAY night** üåÉ (not Saturday!) for GlacierCTF üßä, our final CTF of the quarter ü•≥! There will be no talk or PBR CTF this week - just CTF and Chill‚Ñ¢ ‚òï (and maybe finishing your active member writeups! üìú)

description:

title: Cyber x IEEE: ECTF: Embedded Systems
description:

description:
Dive in ü™Ç to the world of embedded security by joining ACM Cyber üî∂ & IEEE's üî∑ Embedded Capture-the-Flag team üö©! This week, we'll be holding our **last** lecture of the quarter on üîé Analyzing (previous) Attacks üîç!

Make sure to show up, as we'll be giving out the team signup form üìÉ today! Nader will also be offering ‚òÑÔ∏è **upper-div course credit** ‚òÑÔ∏è for participating in ECTF this Winter.

title: Hike Social
description:
**RSVP Required: https://l.acmcyber.com/hike**

On 11/3, join ACM Cyber on a hike on the Temescal Canyon Loop! üå≥ The hike itself will probably take around 2.5-3 hours and is a 4.0 mile round-trip hike to and from the bus stop, gaining around 800 feet in elevation.

We will be taking the Metro 602 bus from the base of the Hill üöå, or from wherever is convenient for you (stops are available throughout Westwood). Don't be late - the bus only runs roughly once an hour! There are no fees to do this hike other than the bus ride, which is covered by your bus pass! üíõ
location: https://maps.app.goo.gl/D6xYTgMRzuYtbPhH6 or your closest Metro 602 bus stop.

title: CTF IRL
description: üéâ Join us for a fun-filled Saturday evening at the IM Field for a classic game of Capture the Flag! üåü Bring your friends and relive the excitement of this elementary school favorite while enjoying some friendly competition. Don‚Äôt miss out on the fun! See you there! üíõüíõ‚öîÔ∏è

title: Cyber Potluck Social
description:
**RSVP Required: https://l.acmcyber.com/potluck**
üéâ Join us for a delicious Cyber Potluck this Saturday at 6 PM after PBR! üåêüçΩÔ∏è‚ú® Bring your favorite dish to share and enjoy a night of great food and even better company. Don‚Äôt miss out on the fun! See you there! üíõüíõüç¥ü•≥üç∞

title: Cyber Academy: Safe Malware Analysis Environments
description: Come learn how to setup your very own ü¶† malware analysis environment so **you** can run malware safely without bricking üß± your machine! We will also spend time working on writeups for the Active Membership requirement.

title: Cyber Summer Research Fellowship: Kickoff!
description: Want to dive deeper üåä into Cyber this summer? Join ‚ú® CSRF ‚ú® - our Cyber Summer Research Fellowship‚Ñ¢ - and work on cutting-edge research ‚òÄÔ∏è with your fellow Cybricks üß±! We'll be tackling three exciting projects this summer: Steganographic Image Detection w/ CNNs üñº, a Blockchain Package Manager w/ Ethereum üì¶, and Library API Misuse Detection w/ low-level JavaScript üêå! Be sure to join our Kickoff next Monday at 6 PM ‚öΩ to learn more!

title: Cyber Summer Research Fellowship: Symposium
description: Come join us this Saturday to see all the cool projects we worked on this summer! ‚òÄÔ∏è üòé üíñ üëÄ

title: PBR: GoogleCTF 2024
description: Get your Googling hats on üß¢ and get ready to capture some flags ‚õ≥! Join PBR this weeekend to take down GoogleCTF 2024 ü¶ñ!

title: PBR: SigpwnyCTF 2024
description: The Sigpwny Train ü¶ÑüöÇ is rolling in fast! Join PBR this weekend for an exciting ride üå¨ with SigpwnyCTF 2024!

title: PBR: Down Under CTF 2024
description: It's getting too hot here in America so join us down under in Australia! Join PBR this weekend to full clear Down Under CTF 2024!

title: PBR: corCTF 2024
description: Wanna be like an Olympian? Join PBR this weekend to take home the gold at corCTF 2024!

title: Cyber Movie Night: Sneakers (1992)
description: Take hacking to the movies with our first Cyber Movie Night of the summer! We'll be watching the classic _Sneakers_, so be sure to pull up!

title: ACM Fall GM
description: We are a group of hackers & developers passionate about cybersecurity. We break things for fun and work to improve our skills in a variety of disciplines, whether it be reverse engineering, binary exploitation, cryptography, or something entirely different. We aim to nurture the love of cybersecurity in the students at UCLA!

We aim to nurture the love of cybersecurity in the students at UCLA!

title: Cyber Fall GM
description: Interested in solving technical puzzles üß© ? Want to learn more about cybersecurity üîê ? Excited to work on cool projects with cool people? ACM Cyber is the club for you! Join us for Cyber's first General Meeting on Wednesday, October 4th from 6-8 pm to learn about what we have planned for this quarter! Come on out to Franz 2258A to solve some challenges, participate in fun activities, and make some friends. Regardless of experience level, we have something for you. There will be free t-shirts üëï so be sure to stop by! P.S. Be sure to bring a laptop to try out some of our challenges yourself.

title: Intro to Reverse Engineering
description: Solve puzzles and learn how to break apart daunting problems, effectively use a debugger, and more! We'll also be hosting CS 33 office hours after the presentation!

title: Binary Analysis Tools
description: Interested in learning how to break down and analyze computer programs? Taking CS 33 and in need of some help with bomb lab? We'll teach you how to take your skills with gdb to next level and introduce you to new techniques and software to make your life easier!

title: Binary Exploitation Tools
description: Ever wonder how hackers write their own exploits? We'll be going over tools for binary exploitation from the basics of how to perform and script traditional attacks such as buffer overflow, stack smashing, and ret2libc - no experience necessary!

title: Software Verification
description: Ever wonder if you could write 100% bug-free code? We'll be looking at the tools and algorithms behind building provably secure code, from SAT solvers to modern theorem provers like Z3 - no experience necessary!

title: Secure OS Lab
description: Want to learn how to develop your own bootloader and kernel? We'll start covering the boot process by printing messages from memory and reading data from the disk

title: Secure OS Lab
description: Want to learn how to develop your own bootloader and kernel? We'll continue by learning more about 32-bit protected mode and loading our own kernel!

title: Secure OS Lab: Aaron Yoo
description: Don't forget to come to Secure OS Lab for an exciting talk from ACM Cyber alumni, Aaron Yoo. Aaron is currently a currently a software engineer at Apple, and if you are interested in learning more about his experience with OS development and what working at Apple is like, be sure to show up!

title: Secure OS Lab
description: We'll continue our work by adding features to make our OS more secure!

title: Secure OS Lab
description: We'll continue our work by adding features to make our OS more secure!

title: Malware Lab
description: Let's develop our own rootkits! We'll start by covering syscalls and shared libraries to set a foundation for our core rootkit.

title: Malware Lab
description: Let's develop our own rootkits! We'll continue by learning more about networking and sockets this week.

title: Malware Lab
description: Now that we've covered the basics of a rootkit, are you excited to design your own features? We'll guide you through exploitation, payloads, and get started with expanding our rootkit!

title: Malware Lab: Sanjana Sarda
description: Don't forget to come to Malware Lab for an exciting talk from ACM Cyber alumni, Sanjana Sarda. Sanjana is currently an Offensive Security Engineer at Anduril Industries. If you are interested in learning more about her experience in the security industry, be sure to show up!

title: Malware Lab
description: We'll continue our work in expanding our rootkit!

title: Spring General Meeting
description: Learn about what we have planned for this quarter! Not only will Cyber Academy cover topics with real industry applications like reverse engineering, program analysis, formal verification, and more, ACM Cyber is also launching a brand new Cyber Lab track where you'll have the opportunity to work on hands-on projects like rootkit malware writing and secure OS development. Furthermore, come to learn more about what Psi Beta Rho, UCLA's top-notch cybersecurity and capture-the-flag team, is doing this spring so you can apply your skills in exciting and competitive ways!

title: Cyber x Studio: Social
description: Confident in your racing ability? Join ACM Cyber and ACM Studio in our competitive Mario Kart tournament! Wager your pride on the tracks, meet new people from both committees, or cheer from the pit stop and play board games!

title: William Wang
description: Looking to sharpen your computer science and cybersecurity skills while engaging in thrilling competitions? Look no further than PBR: UCLA's top-notch cybersecurity team! Join us this week for an exciting talk from ACM Cyber alumni Will Wang who plays CTFs with DiceGang and does blockchain security research at OtterSec! If you're interested in learning about his experience with CTFs and his current work in the security industry, join us!

title: LiveOverflow
description: Want to hear directly from a YouTuber with over 800k subscribers? Make sure to tune into our LiveOverflow talk and Q&A where he'll be talking about his experiences with playing CTFs and pursuing a career in cybersecuirty! LiveOverflow is a YouTuber who makes videos about various IT security topics and his experiences competing in hacking competitions.

title: Cyber x TeachLA: Cipher Lab
description: Teaching students about what a cipher is and showing them how they can build their own symmetric encryption cipher with Java. We'll cover the basic history of encryptions, their weaknesses, and give students an idea of how more advanced symmetric encryption algorithms work.

title: Cyber x SWE: Career Panel
description: Ever thought about a career in cybersecurity? Want to hear directly from professionals in the field? Gain valuable insights into the industry, ask your burning questions, and learn about the exciting opportunities available to you!

title: AI x Cyber: Symposium
description: A celebration and social between ACM AI and ACM Cyber! Join us in a highlight of the cool projects that our committees have been working on this quarter!

title: Intro to Web Hacking
description: Are you interested in learning about the latest techniques and tools for web hacking? Our series of workshops is designed to introduce you to the world of web hacking, and help you develop the skills and knowledge you need to protect against cyber threats.

title: XSS & CSRF
description: Do you want to learn how a hacker once got one million friends on MySpace? Do you want to write a similar exploit yourself? Do you enjoy learning about random 3-letter acronyms that sound vaguely cybersecurity-related? Come join us to learn how to hack some (fake) websites and take over its users' (bots) browsers! No prior experience needed.

title: SQL Injection
description: As w23schools puts it 'SQL Injection is a code injection technique that might destroy your database.' Sounds fun. Jk we're all about ethical hacking! But if you want to explore SQL injection techniques and learn how to defend against them, come to our SQL injection workshop!

title: Intro to Web Auditing
description: Want to learn how to get paid for hacking websites? ACM Cyber is teaming up with Bruinwalk to present a unique real world experience to jump start your ethical hacking career. You will learn about what exactly are bug bounties, what exactly is auditing, and what tools and techniques are used by the professionals. After reviewing some of these techniques, you will get an exclusive chance to HACK the famous Bruinwalk website. No professors' reviews are safe from your technial skills!

title: CTF After Dark Kickoff
description: Get ready to flex your cyber skills and bring your A-game to the ultimate test! CTF AFter Dark is back and better than ever! Come play our Capture the Flag (CTF) competition and show off all that you've learned from our workshops this winter. Winners will be rewarded, so don't miss out!

title: AI Security
description: Calling all tech enthusiasts and AI aficionados! Join us to dive into the cutting-edge of modern security research, with a particular focus on adversarial attacks against neural networks. Join us for a day of learning, hacking, and fun as we explore the intersection of artificial intelligence and cybersecurity.

title: Game Hacking
description: Ever wanted unlimited coins or infinite hp? Have you wished you could take out your in-game enemies in one sweep? Get ready to learn about the fundamentals of game hacking, some of the epic tools at your disposal, and test your skills on a game created by Studio.

title: Professor Yuan Tian
description: Professor Yuan Tian of UCLA's Electrical and Computer Engineering Department and Institute of Law, Technology, and Public Policy will be sharing her invaluable knowledge and expertise in this exciting talk. Her research focuses on developing secure and privacy-friendly computing platforms, with real-world applications integrated into platforms such as Android, Chrome, Azure, and iOS. Join us for an evening filled with thought-provoking discussions and valuable insights!

title: Modern Cryptography
description: Come join us to learn about everythign cryptography, from current methods and attacks on these cryptosystems, to the mathematical and theoretical foundations of it all! We'll be covering a whole mix of things, including AES, RSA, diffie-hellman, one-way functions, secure hashes, and oblivious transfer!

title: LA CTF
description: We are happy to introduce LA CTF 2023, a 42-hour cybersecurity event hosted by ACM Cyber at UCLA and team Psi Beta Rho. This event will take place from Feb 10-12 and features a variety of challenges and events for all skill levels. Everyone is welcome to participate and learn!

title: Winter General Meeting
description: Cyber is back and better than ever, with even more brand-new, cool, exciting things for you'll to hack! Come out to meet our new team members adn find out what events we have in store for you this quarter! We'll also be previewing some of the web-hacking content that we will be going over during Cyber Academy, so be sure to bring a computer!

title: Cyber x Studio: Social
description: Join us and ACM Studio for dinner to hangout with Cyber friends and meet new ones too! We'll first be meeting up at Bruin Bear and then walking to Westwood together to grab dinner adn boba afterwards.

title: LA CTF 2025 - Infra Setup
description: Tentative - designated time to spin up infrastructure for LA CTF 2025. End time is once all infrastructure has deployed and is stable.

title: LA CTF 2025 - Instancer Setup
description: Tentative - designated time to attempt to setup infrastructure.

title: Intro to Docker
description:
SIGN UP REQUIRED: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfoNjZN2hI0Tl6yIQPCsoZ3uVvoloadw9uLTseDdOrK1AWRnQ/viewform

This workshop is designed to give you hands-on experience with Docker on the command line. We'll start by going over basics of how docker works, the components and workflow of Docker, before diving into creating our own Docker containers like a CTF challenge, all the way to deployment. We will then continue with Docker Compose, allowing us to create deployments of multiple containers together. Finally, we will tie it all together by creating challenge.yaml files for the containers we created. This workshop assumes basic Linux command-line knowledge as we will be doing everything on the linux command line. This workshop will use Google Cloud Shell, available at https://shell.cloud.google.com for the development environment.

title: Intro to Kubernetes
description:
SIGN UP REQUIRED: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfoNjZN2hI0Tl6yIQPCsoZ3uVvoloadw9uLTseDdOrK1AWRnQ/viewform

This workshop is designed to give you hands-on experience with Kubernetes as it relates to ACM Cyber and LA CTF infrastructure. We will take the apps created in the Intro to Docker workshop and deploy it to our own Kubernetes cluster on Google Cloud, explaining the components needed in order to access our systems, and learn how to use kubectl with the cluster. We will then show how to manage the cluster once deployed, pushing updates, restarting containers, and reading logs. This workshop assumes you have completed the Intro to Docker workshop or similar prior knowledge.
